description.overview: The Curacha, also known as the Spanner Crab, is a reddish-brown crab species found in the Indo-Pacific region. Males have narrow abdominal flaps and slightly longer legs.
description.habitat: Sandy seabeds from 10 to 100 meters deep.
description.diet: Feeds on small fish, mollusks, and ocean floor detritus.

description.overview: Female Curacha crabs have rounder, wider abdominal flaps used to carry eggs. They tend to be slightly larger-bodied but have smaller claws.
description.habitat: Sandy coastal waters near coral reefs.

description.overview: The male Blue Crab has bright blue claws and a narrow, T-shaped abdominal flap. It is fast and often found in shallow waters.
description.habitat: Sandy and muddy bays and estuaries.
description.diet: Eats fish, mollusks, and other crabs.

description.overview: Female Blue Crabs have red-tipped claws and a wide, rounded abdominal flap. They are known for carrying eggs under their abdomen.
description.diet: Omnivorous â€” consumes plants and small invertebrates.
